title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 73.11 - Expulsion from the plan
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 73.11 - Expulsion from the plan

State Regulations
(a) The
president may expel a participating employer from the plan upon finding that
fraud or abuses in the administration of the plan have been committed or
permitted by the acts or neglect of its officers or agents, or that the
participating employer has failed to carry out satisfactorily its duties and
responsibilities as required under the plan and by this Part. Such expulsion
shall be effective not sooner than two months after notice thereof has been
given by the president to the governing body of the participating
employer. (b) A participating
employer which is expelled from the plan shall not be eligible to rejoin the
plan for one year following such expulsion. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4
ยง
73.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
